name: NewsOK
description: I've been an interactive designer and front-end developer with NewsOK and The Oklahoman since 2009. Alongside some brilliant folks, I've spent the better part of a decade innovating ways to deliver the news to millions of readers.

imgs.caption: We launched a ground-up rebuild of the site in mid-2018, moving from our old two-site strategy to a modern, fully-responsive site. I was tasked with prototyping various layouts that would support our full range of content and advertising across a spectrum of devices, and ultimately translating the final designs into efficient, readable code for our team to work with.

There's a massive bigscreen that wraps around the soutwest corner of our office in downtown Oklahoma City. Rather than use the limited out-of-the box sofware to manage it, we opted to tap into our in-house CMS to drive the screen. I was able to contribute some slide designs as well extend the code that our team wrote to implement the slides.
We used Google's Calendar API to access the video studio's daily schedule, and built a slide that cycle's through the day's events.
Tapping into the same data the drives the screen, I designed and implemented a fun little companion page on our site where you could see all of the content being featured.

The NewsOK video team produces a substantial number of videos weekly. We utilized the YouTube to API present this content in a smart, cohesive manner on our site. You can watch certain videos live as they're happening, or access the full library on demand.

name: The Well Church
description: The Well Church is based in Mustang, OK. I was approached in 2015 by pastor Stephen Myers to walk through their vision of planting a church, and to explore this new church's identity. We honed in on a foundational logo and color palette that would enable this young church to grow and develop with a cohesive identity in place from the beginning.

imgs.caption: Various alternate treatments for different use cases.
